key_findings: S3 buckets are not blocking public access control lists (ACLs).
S3 buckets are not blocking public policies.
S3 buckets are not ignoring public ACLs.
S3 buckets are not restricting public access.
S3 buckets do not have default encryption enabled.
S3 buckets are not configured to use customer-managed encryption keys (KMS).
S3 buckets do not have access logging enabled.
S3 buckets do not have versioning enabled.
IAM policies allow 'ALL' or any AWS principal permissions to resources.
S3 buckets do not have event notifications enabled.
S3 buckets do not have cross-region replication enabled.
S3 buckets do not have a lifecycle configuration.
One S3 bucket is missing a defined 'aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block' resource.
recommendations: Enable 'block_public_acls' for S3 bucket public access blocks.
Enable 'block_public_policy' for S3 bucket public access blocks.
Enable 'ignore_public_acls' for S3 bucket public access blocks.
Enable 'restrict_public_buckets' for S3 bucket public access blocks.
Configure S3 buckets to have default encryption enabled.
Configure S3 buckets to use customer-managed encryption keys (KMS).
Enable access logging for S3 buckets by adding a logging block.
Enable versioning for S3 buckets to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification.
Review and restrict IAM policies that allow 'ALL' or '*' actions/principals to resources.
Configure S3 event notifications for S3 buckets.
Enable cross-region replication for S3 buckets.
Implement lifecycle configurations for S3 buckets.
Define an 'aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block' resource for all S3 buckets.
